title: Practical Biosecurity Best Management Practices for Broiler Growers

tasks.task: Implement biosecurity measures on a farm to prevent disease spread.
subtasks: Install signage and visitor logs at farm entry.
Lock access points to the farm to deter unauthorized visitors.
Provide and enforce the use of protective footwear and clothing for farm visitors.
Maintain clean and designated equipment and vehicle washing procedures.
Educate employees and family members on biosecurity practices.
Use footbaths and sanitation stations for farm personnel.
Exclude birds from chicken houses and secure buildings.
Implement rodent and beetle control programs.
Properly compost dead birds and manage waste disposal.
Regularly inspect and maintain farm perimeter to prevent unauthorized entry.
Educate farm employees on recognizing and reporting potential biosecurity threats.
Utilize foot monitoring systems or cameras to track visitor access.
Wipe down and disinfect personal items like cell phones before entering farm areas.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Implement effective biosecurity practices on a farm to prevent the spread of diseases like avian influenza.
subtasks: Install signage and visitor logs at all farm entrances.
Secure farm premises with locks and gates to restrict unauthorized access.
Enforce the use of dedicated protective footwear and clothing for all visitors.
Ensure that all equipment and vehicles are cleaned and disinfected before and after use.
Educate employees and family members on the importance of adhering to biosecurity protocols.
Use footbaths and sanitation stations at all entry points for farm personnel.
Exclude birds from chicken houses and other buildings to prevent disease spread.
Implement regular rodent and beetle control measures to eliminate potential disease carriers.
Properly compost and manage dead birds and other waste materials.
Maintain strict control over who is allowed on the farm and limit access to necessary personnel only.
Use surveillance cameras or monitoring systems to track visitor activity and entry points.
Regularly sanitize personal items such as cell phones and other equipment before use in agricultural areas.
